page.title: 03THE BLOFIELD BY-PASS
page.content: The Blofield By-pass was built in 1981,to decrease the amount of traffic on the A 47 which runs through Blofield. During the holiday season,holiday makers travelling to Great Yarmouth along the A 47 caused great congestion in the centre of the village of Blofield. When the by-pass was built,two garages and a fish and chip shop situated on the A 47 lost a great amount of their trade, as people no longer passed them on their way to Great Yarmouth. The by-pass is a dual carriage way. The only bridge that goes over the by-pass is near Blofield School.It is the largest single span bridge in Norfolk. The by-pass has made the villages of Blofield and Blofield Heath much quieter.
